title: 111_hr3582
content: The "Census Improvement Act" is the short title of the Act. It includes a limitation on eligibility for the Planning Partnership Program for the 2010 Census. The "Census Improvement Act" limits participation in the Planning Partnership Program for the 2010 census to organizations not indicted for election violations or employing individuals indicted for such violations. Applicable individuals are defined as those employed, contracted, or acting on behalf of the organization and indicted for election violations. State law defines "State" to include the District of Columbia for elections for Federal or State office. SEC. 3. Two-thirds vote required to repeal or limit provisions on confidentiality of certain information. Rulemaking Power: The provisions in this section are enacted by Congress as an exercise of the rulemaking power of the Senate and the House of Representatives. They shall be part of the rules of each House and supersede other rules to the extent of inconsistency. Each House has the constitutional right to change the rules related to its procedures. Voting Requirement: Any bill or resolution affecting section 9 of title 13, United States Code, requires a two-thirds vote to repeal, suspend, or limit its application. Section 9 of title 13, United States Code requires a two-thirds vote from both Houses of Congress for passage or agreement. SEC. 4. REVIEW AND REPORT TO CONGRESS. The Government Accountability Office will review and report to Congress on questions proposed for the 2010 census and American Community Survey, addressing reasons for each question, alternative means of obtaining information, and advantages/disadvantages of obtaining information. The Secretary of Commerce will submit proposed questions for the upcoming American Community Survey and 2010 census to the Government Accountability Office within 30 days of the Act's enactment. This includes views on the advantages and disadvantages of obtaining information through a census or survey compared to alternative means. SEC. 5 prohibits seeking answers to survey or census questions from non-household members during the American Community Survey or 2010 census. The Secretary of Commerce will ensure implementation. SEC. 6 provides definitions. SEC. 6 of the Act provides definitions, including the meaning of "census of population" and the definition of "Member" as a Member of Congress.
